messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the llvm-project program, here is the asan report

This is an LLVM error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

      |                                               ^

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'clang/lib/Sema/SemaDeclCXX.cpp', 'start_line': 9000, 'end_line': 9020}`
responded: I'll analyze the sanitizer report and identify the bug to create a patch. Let me start by examining the stack trace and understanding the issue.

From the stack trace, I can see the crash occurs in:
- `clang::Sema::CheckExplicitlyDefaultedComparison` at line 9010:54 in `clang/lib/Sema/SemaDeclCXX.cpp`
- The lambda function is accessing a `FriendDecl const*` which seems to be causing the issue

Let me examine the relevant code:

message.name: viewcode

messages.message:
Invoking: `locate` with `{'symbol': 'FriendDecl::getFriendDecl'}`
responded: Now I can see the issue! The problem is on line 9010 where `F->getFriendDecl()->getCanonicalDecl()` is called. The issue is that `F->getFriendDecl()` can return `nullptr`, and then calling `getCanonicalDecl()` on a null pointer causes a crash.

Let me check the `getFriendDecl()` method to understand when it can return null:

message.name: locate
message.result:
Here is the location of the symbol getFriendDecl:
clang/include/clang/AST/DeclFriend.h:141:14

message.name: viewcode

messages.message:
Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'clang/include/clang/AST/DeclFriend.h', 'start_line': 50, 'end_line': 90}`
responded: Now I can see that `getFriendDecl()` returns `Friend.dyn_cast<NamedDecl *>()`, which can indeed return `nullptr` if the friend declaration names a type rather than a declaration. Let me look at the `Friend` member to understand this better:

message.name: viewcode
message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 50 to line 90 in clang/include/clang/AST/DeclFriend.h:
50| ///
51| /// The semantic context of a friend decl is its declaring class.
52| class FriendDecl final
53|     : public Decl,
54|       private llvm::TrailingObjects<FriendDecl, TemplateParameterList *> {
55|   virtual void anchor();
56| 
57| public:
58|   using FriendUnion = llvm::PointerUnion<NamedDecl *, TypeSourceInfo *>;
59| 
60| private:
61|   friend class CXXRecordDecl;
62|   friend class CXXRecordDecl::friend_iterator;
63| 
64|   // The declaration that's a friend of this class.
65|   FriendUnion Friend;
66| 
67|   // A pointer to the next friend in the sequence.
68|   LazyDeclPtr NextFriend;
69| 
70|   // Location of the 'friend' specifier.
71|   SourceLocation FriendLoc;
72| 
73|   // Location of the '...', if present.
74|   SourceLocation EllipsisLoc;
75| 
76|   /// True if this 'friend' declaration is unsupported.  Eventually we
77|   /// will support every possible friend declaration, but for now we
78|   /// silently ignore some and set this flag to authorize all access.
79|   LLVM_PREFERRED_TYPE(bool)
80|   unsigned UnsupportedFriend : 1;
81| 
82|   // The number of "outer" template parameter lists in non-templatic
83|   // (currently unsupported) friend type declarations, such as
84|   //     template <class T> friend class A<T>::B;
85|   unsigned NumTPLists : 31;
86| 
87|   FriendDecl(DeclContext *DC, SourceLocation L, FriendUnion Friend,
88|              SourceLocation FriendL, SourceLocation EllipsisLoc,
89|              ArrayRef<TemplateParameterList *> FriendTypeTPLists)
90|       : Decl(Decl::Friend, DC, L), Friend(Friend), FriendLoc(FriendL),

messages.message:
Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'testcases/llvm-gh-132249/input/poc.cpp', 'start_line': 1, 'end_line': 15}`
responded: Perfect! Now I understand the issue. The `Friend` member is a `PointerUnion<NamedDecl *, TypeSourceInfo *>`, which means it can hold either a `NamedDecl*` (for friend function declarations) or a `TypeSourceInfo*` (for friend type declarations). When `getFriendDecl()` is called, it uses `dyn_cast<NamedDecl *>()` which returns `nullptr` if the friend declaration is actually a type declaration.

The bug is in the lambda function at line 9008-9011 where it doesn't check if `F->getFriendDecl()` returns `nullptr` before calling `getCanonicalDecl()` on it.

Let me look at the test case to understand what triggers this:

message.name: viewcode
